data.name: CreateWallet_Dialog_ActiveWallet_Message
data.value: A wallet is already active. Would you like to close the current active wallet and make this new wallet active ?
data.comment: Used in CreateWalletView. Dialog Box appears when there is already and active wallet and prompts the user to close the active wallet and replace it with newly created wallet or not.

data.name: CreateWallet_Dialog_ActiveWallet_Title
data.comment: Used in CreateWalletView. Dialog Box appears when there is already and active wallet and prompts the user to close the active wallet and replace it with newly created wallet or not.

data.name: CreateWallet_Dialog_Insufficient_Message
data.value: Password field is required. Wallet password must be at least *NUM* characters.
data.comment: Used in CreateWalletView. Dialog Box appears when the password entered is weak.

data.name: CreateWallet_Dialog_Insufficient_Title
data.comment: Used in CreateWalletView. Dialog Box appears when the password entered is weak.

data.name: CreateWallet_Dialog_Invalid_Message
data.value: Name field is required. Password field is required and must be at least *NUM* characters.
data.comment: Used in CreateWalletView. Dialog Box appears when both the name and password field are invalid/empty

data.name: CreateWallet_Dialog_Invalid_Title
data.comment: Used in CreateWalletView. Dialog Box appears when both the name and password field are invalid/empty

data.name: CreateWallet_Dialog_NameEmpty_Message
data.comment: Used in CreateWalletView. Dialog Box appears when the Name field is left empty

data.name: CreateWallet_Dialog_NameEmpty_Title
data.comment: Used in CreateWalletView. Dialog Box appears when the Name field is left empty

data.name: CreateWallet_Message
data.value: Please fill in the following fields to create a new wallet
data.comment: Used in CreateWalletView. Label: LblMessage

data.comment: Used in CreateWalletView. Label: LblNameExample

data.comment: Used in CreateWalletView. Label: LblPass

data.comment: Used in CreateWalletView. Label: LblTestnetHelper

data.name: CreateWallet_Title
data.comment: Used in CreateWalletView. Window Title

data.name: Error_A100
data.value: Wallet File does not exist at specified location *path*. This wallet will now close.
data.comment: Error_A100 refers to the cleint not being able to locate the wallet file at the location specified when imported/created. Culprit: The user has moved or deleted the wallet file while it was in use.

data.name: Error_A100_Lock
data.comment: Used in ManageWalletView. Error_A100 occured when the user tried to lock the wallet.

data.name: Error_A100_Pass
data.comment: Used in ManageWalletView. Error_A100 occured when the user tried to change the wallet password

data.name: Error_A200
data.value: There already exists Jet Wallet files in the specified path *path* & *recoverypath*. Please give your wallet a new name or delete the existing Jet Wallet Files.
data.comment: Error_A200 refers to the situation where a user is trying to create a wallet with a name that is already in use/taken.

data.name: Error_A201
data.value: A Jet Wallet file already exists with the name '*name*' in the specified path *path*. Please give your wallet a new name. Note that the recovery wallet file for '*name*' is missing.
data.comment: Error_A201 refers to the situation where a user is trying to create a wallet with a name that is already in use. However, the recovery file associated with the existing wallet is missing.

data.name: Error_A202
data.value: A Jet Wallet recovery file already exists with the name '*name*' in the specified path *recoverypath*. Please give your wallet a new name.
data.comment: Error_A202 refers to the situation where a user is trying to create a wallet with a name this is already in use. However, the regular .jet wallet file is missing and only the recovery file is found.

data.name: Error_A300
data.value: Wallet Files failed to update. Wallet Files do not exist at specified location.
data.comment: Error_A300 refers to the situation where the client is attempting to update the respected wallet file, but the wallet files could not be found in their location in which they where loaded into the client.

data.name: Error_A400
data.value: The previously active wallet failed to load. The wallet file could not be found.
data.comment: Error_A400 refers to situation where the previously active wallet file location could not be found. This error appears at the start of the application when the user is prompted to enter the password for the previously active wallet.

data.name: Error_A500
data.value: The file selected is a Jet Wallet recovery file. You will need the respected Recovery Phrase to unlock the wallet. If you are trying to recover a wallet, use the 'Recover Wallet' option in the File menu tab.
data.comment: Error_A500 refers to the situation where the user is trying to import a jet wallet recovery file instead of a regular jet wallet file

data.name: Error_A501
data.value: Invalid file type. Jet Wallet files are of the form '.jet' ie) mywallet.jet
data.comment: Error_A501 refers to the situation where the user is trying to import an invalid file type, that is, a non jet wallet file.

data.name: Error_A502
data.value: Incorrect file type. The file must be a Jet Wallet recovery file. ie) mywallet.recover.jet. Jet Wallet recovery files are hidden by default. You may have to make them visible.
data.comment: Error_A502 refers to the situation where the user is trying to recover a wallet, and imports a regular jet wallet file.

data.name: Error_A503
data.value: Invalid file type. Jet Wallet Recovery files are of the form '.recover.jet' ie) mywallet.recover.jet
data.comment: Error_A503 refers to the situation where the user is trying to recover a wallet, and imports an invalid file type, ie) .jpg file

data.name: Main_Dialog_ActiveWallet_Message
data.value: A wallet is already active. Would you like to close the present active wallet and make this wallet active?
data.comment: Used in MainWindow. Dialog Box appears when a user recovers or imports a wallet while a wallet is already active.

data.name: ManageWallet_Dialog_Invalid_Message
data.value: The current wallet password entered is incorrect and the confirmation password did not match the new password. Please try again.
data.comment: Used in ManageWalletView. Dialog Box appears when the current password is incorrect and the new password and confirmation password don't match.

data.name: ManageWallet_Dialog_Invalid_Title
data.comment: Used in ManageWalletView. Dialog Box appears when the current password is incorrect and the new password and confirmation password don't match.

data.name: ManageWallet_Dialog_Match_Message
data.value: The new password cannot match the current password. Please try again.
data.comment: Used in ManageWalletView. Dialog Box appears when the new password matched the current wallet password.

data.name: ManageWallet_Dialog_Match_Title
data.comment: Used in ManageWalletView. Dialog Box appears when the new password matched the current wallet password.

data.name: ManageWallet_Dialog_Success_Message
data.comment: Used in ManageWalletView. Dialog Box appears when the user entered the current wallet password and the new password and confirmation password match. In other words, the wallet password has been changed successfully.

data.name: ManageWallet_Dialog_Success_Title
data.comment: Used in ManageWalletView. Dialog Box appears when the user entered the current wallet password and the new password and confirmation password match. In other words, the wallet password has been changed successfully.

data.comment: Used in ManageWalletView. Dialog Box appears when the new password and confirmation password don't match.

data.name: RecoveryPhrase_Intro
data.value: The following bold text of words is your newly created wallet's 'Recovery Phrase'. The Recovery Phrase is used to recover your wallet when you forget/misplace your password.
data.comment: Used in RecoveryPhraseView. TextBlock: Intro

data.name: RecoveryPhrase_Outro
data.value: This is the only time you will have access to the Recovery Phrase so store it somewhere safe and away from prying eyes. This phrase is the only alternative to recover a wallet who's password is forgotton/lost.
data.comment: Used in RecoveryPhraseView. TextBlock: Outro

data.name: Welcome_IntroMessage
data.value: Thank you for downloading Jet Wallet. Jet Wallet is a Bitcoin Wallet that you can use to send and receive Bitcoin securely. You will find that this wallet software is quite defensive for good reason.
data.comment: Used in WelcomeView. TextBlock: Intro

data.name: Welcome_OutroMessage
data.value: Remember to use a strong password when creating a wallet. If you forget your wallet password, you can recover your wallet using the 'Recovery Phrase' uniqely generated for each wallet created.
data.comment: Used in WelcomeView. TextBlock: Outro

data.name: Welcome_QuoteMessage
data.value: One of the major motivations of Bitcoin was to give people the ability to control and personally manage their own funds. This software was built to support that motivation. It is also open source.
data.comment: Used in WelcomeView. TextBlock: Quote

data.name: Welcome_Skip
data.comment: Used in WelcomeView. Button: BtnSkip

data.comment: Used in ReceiveView. Dialog Box appears when the user clicks cancel before the transaction appears with the associated receiving address.

data.comment: Used in ReceiveView. Dialog Box appears when the user clicks cancel before the transaction appears with the associated receiving address.

data.name: Receive_Dialog_Success_Message

data.name: Send_Dialog_Confirm_Message
data.value: You are about to send *btc_amount* *btc_symbol* (*symbol* *curr_amount* *curr*) to *address*. All transactions are final and irreversible once broadcasted. Continue ?
data.comment: Used in SendView. Dialog box appears as when the user is about to send bitcoin. It is a final confirmation before the transaction is built and broadcasted to the network.

data.name: Send_Dialog_Confirm_Title
data.comment: Used in SendView. Dialog box appears as when the user is about to send bitcoin. It is a final confirmation before the transaction is built and broadcasted to the network.

data.comment: Used in SendView. Dialog box appears when the user enters an incorrect password when trying to send bitcoin.

data.comment: Used in SendView. Dialog box appears when the user enters an invalid address, ie) too short or invalid characters

data.name: Send_Dialog_NotEnoughFunds_Title
data.comment: Used in SendView. Dialog box appears when the user is trying to send an amount that is greater then the funds of the wallet

data.comment: Used in SendView. Dialog box appears when the user confirms sending the funds and the transaction is broadcasted successfully.

data.comment: Used in SendView. Dialog box appears when the user confirms sending the funds and the transaction is broadcasted successfully.

data.name: Send_Dialog_Unsuccess_Message
data.value: An attempt to broadcast the transaction was unsuccessful. Please try again. If the problem persists, please check your network connection.
data.comment: Used in SendView. Dialog box appears when the user confirms sending the funds and the transaction could not be broadcasted.

data.name: Send_Dialog_Unsuccess_Title
data.comment: Used in SendView. Dialog box appears when the user confirms sending the funds and the transaction could not be broadcasted.

data.name: Error_N100
data.value: Jet Wallet was unable to fetch data from its online resources. Please check your internet connection and your firewall settings.
data.comment: Error_A200 refers to the situation where JetWallet could not retrieve data from its online resources. ie) BTC price, fee rate

data.name: TxInfo_Dialog_Fail_Message
data.value: Unfortunately, JetWallet could not retrieve the data requested. Sorry for the inconvenience. Please try again at a later time.
data.comment: Used in TxInfoView. Dialog Box appears when both blockchain api resources fail. Either due to downtime or no internet connection.

data.name: TxInfo_Dialog_Fail_Title
data.comment: Used in TxInfoView. Dialog Box appears when both blockchain api resources fail. Either due to downtime or no internet connection.
